name: Cypress Pointe Resort

reviews.text: This is a very conveniently sited resort situated midway between International Drive and the Disney Parks.
reviews.title: Great Villas and location

reviews.text: The Villas are very comfortable, clean and well appointed. the pool and hot tub are great and the pool stays open til late.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a two bedroomed vila which was on the ground floor. the kitchen was well appointed, but maybe there wasn't quite enough crockery etc, because if you didn't use the dishwasher every day, you soon ran out of cups etc.
reviews.title: central to disney

reviews.text: That aside, the level of equipment was more than adequate.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: There are a few restaurants within walking distance of the resort , if you wish to risk life and limb there are more across the road, but we elected to drive for safety.
reviews.title: Families Beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I like to be positive when I can, so the good things about Cypress Pointe are: location (close to Disney World and other theme parks); quiet; clean; lots of activities and amenities; ample supply of clean towels; lots of eating opportunities nearby, although most are chain restaurants; pleasant staff; little pressure to take the sales presentations; renovations and upgrades going on. It would be a great place to take kids and use as a base to visit the theme parks. But for just two adults who want to have a comfortable place to use as a base, beware of the one-bedroom "B" units!
reviews.title: Beware the B Units!

likes.liked: — Centrally located to sights we were interested in seeing, and to friends we planned to visit
likes.disliked: — Size and layout of our unit

reviews.text: We've had excellent one-bedroom units at other resorts. This is the first time we've experienced: living/dining/kitchen in one 8' x12' space; no TV in living room; HVAC that was difficult to adjust to a comfortable level; sofa bed that when opened must have violated fire codes--it blocked access to the door; a balcony that was unusable because of its tiny size and location over the boiler room (noise). The mattress was hard and uncomfortable. The unit is supposed to sleep four; it's uncomfortable for two people, impossible for four.
reviews.title: OK for Short Stays

likes.disliked: — small unit, cigarette smoke (smell), shows its age (could use renovation)

reviews.title: Almost perfect
reviews.text: Because of a key mix-up at check-in, we saw the adjoining two-bedroom unit, which was large, comfortable, and well-appointed. It really increased our disappointment to see the tiny, badly-organized space we drew for the week.
I would go back to Cypress Pointe, but only in a two-bedroom unit. I would not recommend the one-bedroom units for anyone wanting a comfortable place to relax after sightseeing.
reviews.title: As Good As Any Other Orlando Resort We've Stayed In!

likes.liked: — The pool area was fun for all ages.

reviews.text: My family stayed at Cypress Pointe Grande Villas for 7 nights (12/20-12/27/08) during our holiday vacation to WDW. The resort location was great only about 1 mile from Downtown Disney. We had a 1 bedroom villa, far too small and the layout was poor. However, the room was clean and we were provided with plenty of towels etc. We did have to deal with cigarette smoke each morning and evening as came under the door and through the vents from the ajoining unit. We had to stuff towels under the door and kept the sliding door open to deal with the smell. We knew we would not have laundry facilities in our villa as it was only 1br, but didn't realize that their would only be one coin operated washer and dryer for the whole building. This made laundy a hassel, and when asked the front desk told us the closes wash dry and fold service laundramat was 15 or more miles away. The pool was nice and never crowded and the onsite mini-mart was great, not too overpriced. We would not likely return to this resort, as we are Marriott Vacation Club owners and the facilities and amenities are much greater at Marriott properties. However, if we were to stay her again we would definately pay the extra for a 2br unit.
reviews.title: Large room, lots of amenities
Pleasantly Surprised
reviews.text: Just got back from a one week vacation and stayed at this resort.
I was a little nervous from what all the reviews say since it was just my husband and me staying in a one bedroom timeshare from the reviews I thought we were doomed!
reviews.title: Three times the space for a third the price.

reviews.text: Much to my surprise it was a nice one bedroom suite in the B UNITS....2 nice flatscreen TV's one in the kitchen one in the bedroom, nice size king bed comfortable, huge bathroom with big tub and his and hers sinks...full kitchen
reviews.title: We will never stay in a standard hotel room again!

reviews.text: The positive points:
reviews.title: Mixed Blessings !!

reviews.text: nice pool
reviews.title: Perfect for a big group

reviews.text: We were wary after reading the reviews but had a lovely surprise when we arrived, the hotel staff were very pleasent and helpful, unlike the past reviews which said they were unhelpful, the apartment was wonderful, so clean and spacious, the pool was great and staff again friendly, not much more to say really only that we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again, in fact wouldn't stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: The best!

reviews.text: It was great in Cypress Pointe, on the first week we stayed in Cypress Pointe in room 2108a and it was nice! Then we stayed in Cypress Pointe Grande Villa's in the seccond week and that was even better with a HUGE TV !! that was good. It was overlooking the pool with music on for the pool so it was lovely!!
reviews.title: Perfect Place to stay!

likes.liked: — How near it was to the theme parks and how clean it was
likes.disliked: — The Staff at the front desk because they weren't that helpful and abit stroppy

reviews.title: What a great family resort
reviews.text: I would reccomend this place to anyone who wants to go to the theme parks because its only about 10 minutes away from universal Studios, 5 from Seaworld and 5 for Disney! so thats great! But I wouldn't reccoment it for a honeymoon or a quiet gettaway because its very busy on the road outside and the nearest beach is about an hour an a half away.
Over all its great!!
reviews.title: Great Place !!!

reviews.text: We have just returned from a two week holiday in Florida stoping at Cypress Pointe. I booked this hotel quite some time ago and got a wonderful price, I booked 3 two bedroom apartments 1 for myself husband and son, another for my brother wife and 2 children then one for my mum and dad, we had had friends who stopped here and strongly recommeded it.
reviews.title: WILL NEVER GO BACK!!!

likes.disliked: — The way the staff treated our request, the unit itself

description: Cypress Pointe Resort is a timeshare resort managed by Vacation Resorts International.
